I have been following this site regularly and thanks for all the info. I wa=
s wondering Misty if you could tell me what you are using for your evps. Im=
 in the market for a recorder and have been impressed with your evps. Thank=
s and keep up the good work. 
Mary




________________________________
Fro=
m: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tue=
sday, January 13, 2009 12:31:45 PM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] New Water EVP


Heres=
 a few voices from my latest session recording water then slowing down -74%=
 in audacity. For me they are quite loud and the clarity was great. I recor=
ded these on a night of the full moon (which does seem to help).

Attaching=
 a few of the clearer ones to this post and for those who dont get the dail=
ies you can listen on my esnips site. For the other methods click on my pro=
file there and you will see folders listed.

http://www.esnips. com/web/New=
EVPVo ices

Misty

<P>Heres a few voices from my latest session recording water then slowing down -74% in audacity. For me they are quite loud and the clarity was great. I recorded these on a night of the full moon (which does seem to help).<BR><BR>Attaching a few of the clearer ones to this post and for those who dont get the dailies you can listen on my esnips site. For the other methods click on my profile there and you will see folders listed.<BR><BR><A href="http://www.esnips.com/web/NewEVPVoices" target=_blank rel=nofollow>http://www.esnips. com/web/NewEVPVo ices</A><BR><BR>Misty<BR><BR></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></div><br>
